Data Structures | Macros
Disk
Stratify OS » Device Interface
Collaboration diagram for Disk:

Detailed Description

This is the interface for accessing disks. The disk can be any external storage device such as an SD card, serial flash chip, etc. Disks are always read/write block devices.

Data Structures

struct  disk_attr_t
 Disk attributes. More...
 

Macros

#define I_DISK_PROTECT
 
#define I_DISK_UNPROTECT
 
#define I_DISK_ERASEBLOCK
 
#define I_DISK_ERASEDEVICE
 
#define I_DISK_POWERDOWN
 
#define I_DISK_POWERUP
 
#define I_DISK_GETSIZE
 
#define I_DISK_GETBLOCKSIZE
 
#define I_DISK_GETBLOCKERASETIME
 
#define I_DISK_GETDEVICEERASETIME
 
#define I_DISK_ERASEBLOCKS
 
#define I_DISK_GETATTR
 
#define I_DISK_BUSY
 

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I_DISK_BUSY

See if the disk is busy. This ioctl call will return greater than one if the device is busy and 0 if disk is not busy.

#define I_DISK_ERASEBLOCK

This request erases a block of memory. The ctl argurment is an address that is contained in the block to erase.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_ERASEBLOCK, 0x1000);
#define I_DISK_ERASEBLOCKS

This request erases the blocks specified in disk_erase_block_t

#define I_DISK_ERASEDEVICE

This request erases the device.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_ERASEDEVICE);
#define I_DISK_GETATTR

Request the disk attributes.

#define I_DISK_GETBLOCKERASETIME

This request gets the amount of time to erase a block.

Example:

1 uint32_t useconds;
2 useconds = ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_GETBLOCKERASETIME);
3 ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_ERASEBLOCK, 0x1000);
4 usleep(useconds);
#define I_DISK_GETBLOCKSIZE

This request gets the size of the smallest eraseable block.

Example:

1 uint32_t size;
2 size = ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_GETBLOCKSIZE);
#define I_DISK_GETDEVICEERASETIME

This request gets the amount of time required to erase the device.

Example:

1 uint32_t useconds;
2 useconds = ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_GETDEVICEERASETIME);
3 ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_ERASEDEVICE, 0x1000);
4 usleep(useconds);
#define I_DISK_GETSIZE

This request gets the size of the memory on the device.

Example:

1 uint32_t size;
2 size = ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_GETSIZE);
#define I_DISK_POWERDOWN

This request powers down the device.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_POWERDOWN);
#define I_DISK_POWERUP

This request powers up the device.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_POWER_UP);
#define I_DISK_PROTECT

This request applies the software write protect to the entire device.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_PROTECT);
#define I_DISK_UNPROTECT

This request removes the software write protect from the entire device.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_DISK_UNPROTECT);
